alert.note: Alert for Conejos; Mineral; Rio Grande (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 18 at 2:31PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...SPECIAL HYDROLOGIC OUTLOOK... This outlook is for the Rio Grande Basin in south-central Colorado, primarily for area rivers and creeks in Mineral, Rio Grande and Conejos Counties. This outlook is valid from May 18 to May 23, 2023. The potential for minor flooding and inundation of low-lying areas, due to accelerated snowmelt runoff, is higher than normal in the western Rio Grande Basin. ...OUTLOOK FOR THE NEXT 5 DAYS... Current snowmelt runoff is expected to accelerate for the remainder of this week and through the weekend with nighttime temperatures expected to stay above freezing and with increased rain-on-snow potential for the higher elevations. Sustained, higher flows can be expected for the Rio Grande and its tributaries, including the Conejos and Alamosa Rivers. Bankfull flows in addition to some minor inundation of low-lying areas is possible along area creeks and rivers in Mineral, Rio Grande, and Conejos Counties. Any snowmelt flooding that develops will most likely be minor and would only result in minimal property damage and minor public threat or inconvenience. ...ADDITIONAL INFORMATION... Visit our web site at weather.gov/pub for more hydrologic information including graphs of probabilistic river outlooks. The National Weather Service Pueblo CO hydrology page can be accessed by clicking the Rivers and Lakes tab near the top of the page.
